thread.title: Pack, Unpack, Repack: The Military Way to Pack Your Bags Better
thread.title_full: Pack, Unpack, Repack: The Military Way to Pack Your Bags Better

author: Patrick Allan
title: Pack, Unpack, Repack: The Military Way to Pack Your Bags Better
text:
Photo by Paul Robertson . 
Packing travel bags and luggage well is a skill. If you want to be good at it, you have to practice, just like anything else. 
When Bekah Defelice at Thrillist asked a bunch of soldiers, airmen, sailors, and other U.S. military personnel for packing tips, the most common suggestion was to practice your packing. Over and over. When you’re leaving for a trip, pack your bag, then unpack it completely, then repack it again a few times over. You’ll get better at packing your bag so you can do it faster—which is helpful when it’s time to head home—and it forces you to memorize where every item is in your bag. If you need to get to something quickly, you won’t have to waste time digging around. While you’re practicing, lay everything out in a staging zone, like your bed or kitchen counter, then get to it. Pack, unpack, repack.
